intro: Acrotriche ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved acrotriche, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne in dense inflorescences. Acrotriche ovalifolia is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments. It is valued for its ornamental potential and has been studied for its potential ecological roles in coastal ecosystems.
